author: VNExplorer
title: 600 gather at Batu Caves for fuss-free show of devotion
text: Some of the Hindu devotees who gathered at Batu Caves for a peaceful response to a recent video by a Moroccan social influencer. PETALING JAYA: Some 600 Hindus congregated at Batu Caves today for a devotional gathering in response to foreign social media influencers accused of insulting the faith. In a statement, Swashna Subramaniam, who led the singing of the religious song, said the gathering was held to show that prayers could be “done in a peaceful manner without courting controversies.” The event was co-organised by Rajeswary Apahu and volunteers from Hindu Volunteers Movement. Some of those at the gathering came all the way from Kedah and Singapore, according to S Shashi Kumar, who heads the Global Human Rights Federation, a local NGO. Shashi had recently criticised a Moroccan YouTuber who courted controversy with a video of him reciting Quranic verses at Batu Caves, in front of a Hindu idol. There must be mutual respect at all places of worship. “Only then, we can live in peace and harmony,” he said in a statement. The Moroccan content creator, Abdellatif Ouisa, has since apologised, saying he thought Batu Caves was a historic site rather than a religious one. He said he did not know the 42m-tall statue was of the Hindu deity Lord Murugan. However, Abdellatif’s apology was described as “lame and unacceptable” by Shashi. Shashi said there had been two other cases where foreigners recited Quranic verses at Batu Caves, attacking non-Muslims.

author: Editorial La República S.A.S.
title: Scotiabank Colpatria a través de Spark conecta a los empleados con voluntariados
text:
Con una visión renovada de responsabilidad social, Scotiabank Colpatria, liderado por Jabar Singh, contribuye al bienestar social mediante su plataforma global de voluntariado, Spark. Esta herramienta no solo conecta a los empleados con oportunidades de voluntariado y donación, sino que también redefine la manera en que las empresas integran la sostenibilidad y el impacto social en sus operaciones.
En 2024, Spark alcanzó cifras en Colombia, cerca de 30.000 horas de voluntariado registradas, más de $1.068 millones en contribuciones y cientos de organizaciones beneficiadas. Con una red global que incluye más de dos millones de entidades benéficas .
Lo innovador de Spark radica en su modelo de recompensas. Por cada hora de voluntariado aprobada, los empleados reciben US$12 que se transforman en donaciones para las organizaciones de su elección. Este esquema no solo motiva a los colaboradores a ser agentes activos del cambio, sino que también asegura un flujo constante de recursos para las iniciativas sociales.
Las actividades lideradas por Spark van desde la siembra de árboles y el cuidado animal hasta la construcción de viviendas y la readecuación de espacios escolares. Estos esfuerzos no solo generan un impacto visible en las comunidades, sino que también fomentan la cohesión entre los colaboradores, quienes aportan tiempo, energía y recursos a causas que resuenan con sus valores.
“La meta es clara: aumentar los recursos en recompensas por horas de voluntariado y beneficiar aún más a las organizaciones que apoyamos ”, afirmó Singh.

author: @KNOE8
title: Severe storms leave trail of damage throughout Ouachita Parish
text:
MONROE, La. (KNOE) - Residents and institutions in South Monroe are recovering after a severe storm Tuesday left homes damaged and power out across the region, with Richwood bearing the brunt.
At Greater Free Gift Baptist Church, Bishop Rodney McFarland reported significant damage to both the interior and exterior of the building.
“As you’ve seen, there is quite a bit of damage inside, and still more we haven’t assessed due to the power outage,” McFarland said. “We’re now trying to reach a roofing company to tarp the holes.”
Church events planned for later this week are postponed, but Sunday worship will take place at the Emily P. Robinson Recreation Center.
Several schools, including Richwood Middle and High School, were closed due to outages. Residents also reported severe damage to homes.
“The window started banging, everything came through the roof,” said Anna, a local resident. “I had to crawl to the bedroom and hide under a mattress. A tree fell through the kitchen—when I moved, the floor just gave out.”
Officials urge displaced residents to contact the Red Cross at 1-800-RED-CROSS for shelter and assistance.

title: Winter sports heat up winter tourism in NW China - China.org.cn
text:

下载安装Flash播放器 At the Songmingyan International Ski Resort located in Hezheng County, Linxia Hui Autonomous Prefecture of northwest China's Gansu Province, visitors were immersing themselves in a world of ice and snow themed on Boonie Bears, a popular animation in China.
"The brand-new feast of diverse winter sports, elements of animation, and various forms of ice sculptures satisfy tourists' appetite as they have grown quite fond of winter sports in recent years," said Liu Baiyue, office director of the Songmingyan International Ski Resort.
Previously, as the temperature declined dramatically in winter, the natural landscape in northwest regions became less captivating to the public's eyes.
The gaining popularity of winter sports is injecting new vitality into the local "tourism off-season" and is pushing the staff of ski resorts to increasingly spin a new twist on previous breakthroughs.
In addition to the Boonie Bears theme park, the ski resort has also expanded the playground to about 20 times larger, offering more choices of entertainment facilities for the public to enjoy, including over 60 amusement activities, Liu noted.
"The ski resorts are bustling with tourists," said Liu, adding that the ski resort welcomed over 24,000 visitors since its opening on November 24, 2023.
Statistics showed that during the ninth National Mass Ice and Snow Season held from December 2022 to April 2023, various levels and types of winter sports events were organized in Gansu, attracting approximately two million people to participate.
Due to the surge in public demand for ice skating and skiing, Zhangye City in Gansu, a famous tourist city on the ancient Silk Road, has increased the number of outdoor ski resorts to 15 from 9 last year, making ice and snow sports facilities accessible throughout the city and countryside.
"Winter sports heat up winter tourism in northwest China, as well as more teenagers' enthusiasm," said Bai Jianxiang, deputy director of the Zhangye Administration of Sports.
According to Ma Ji, a ski instructor at a resort located in Lanzhou City, the capital city of Gansu, as the winter vacation approaches, the number of children learning to ski rises, and parents even enroll in the courses as early as a month ago.
"I feel like a bird when I am skiing down the slopes, even though I always fall over," said eight-year-old Wang Bingran.
In Zhangye City, more than 4,000 young students are obtaining training in skiing courses organized by the government.
Nowadays, the local government of Gansu is also trying to sustain the public's passion for winter sports and extend their interests to land curling and speed inline skating, achieving frequent use of the sports field.
